2019-20 School Year Revised Calendar (Pending Board Approval)

Frazier school district will be closed indefinitely, pursuant to Governor Wolf's directive that all K-12 Pennsylvania schools be closed due to Coronavirus (COVID-19) safety measures. All activities will be suspended and district facilities will not be available. At this time the District is not accepting visitors.

span.span: The mission of the Frazier School District is to inspire and empower ourÂ students so that they can become lifelong learners who are respectful, responsible and productive citizens in a global society.

span.strong: Due to the Coronavirus outbreak and the State of Emergency declared by the Governor, this meeting will not take place in person at the Districtâs Central Administration Office but will be a virtual meeting.Â Public comments will be heard.Â If you would like to be heard at the meeting please send an email to publiccomment@fraziersd.org.Â Include in the email, your full name, phone number, and whether or not you will be addressing an item on the meeting agenda or open public comment.Â The host will call your name and unmute you when the meeting is open for public comment.Â All requests for comment must be emailed no later than 4:00 PM on Monday, April 27.Â This will allow for the coordination and scheduling of your comment(s) during the virtual meeting.Â The meeting agenda will be posted no later than 12:00PM on Monday, April 27.

p.span: Visit our Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) Information site by clicking on the link below.Â All information regarding Frazier School District's response
to the COVID-19 pandemic will be posted there.Â Conoravirus (COVID-19) Information

h1.span: Sign up for meals during School Shutdown

span.strong: The meal pickup schedule has been updated to reflect coverage for weekend meal pickups. New schedule commences on April 13, 2020.

p.span: Parents will be able to order breakfast and lunch during our school closure for children Pre-K-18 years old.Â Meals can be picked up at the main entrance of Frazier Middle School on
between the hours of 11 am and 12 pm.Â Please fill out the form below if you are planning on ordering a meal.Â The form only needs to be filled out once throughout the closure.

If you are unable to complete the form online, please call Ms. Kelly Calderone at 724-736-9507 x431 and leave a message with your student(s) name, grade, any dietary restrictions and the meals they are requesting to receive.

**As recommended to eliminate exposure to COVID-19, meals will be distributed twice per week (Tuesday and Friday). Requested meals will be distributed in separate packages. You will need to pick-up on both days to receive all meals for the week. Tuesdays will cover Tuesday/Wednesday/Thursday and Fridays will cover Friday/Saturday/Sunday/Monday.

The district has provided resources that may be utilized by students in Grades Pre-K-12 as a means of retention of information during times that school is not in session.Â If you need any help or assistance, please contact your child's building principal.
Resources can be found on our Educational Resource Page.

On Thursday, April 16, the College Board hosted a webinar to share information about this yearâs at-home AP Exams and how to help your child prepare.Â You may view the recorded version of the webinar by registering here
